greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest prime factor of 1+smaller term of twin primes.
comment: Also: Largest prime factor of the average, or the sum, of twin prime pairs. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 03 2011
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 101 is the 9th lesser twin, 102 = 2*3*17, and its max p factor is 17=a(9).
program: (PARI) p=3; for(n=1,1e3, until(o+2==p,p=nextprime(2+o=p)); print1(vecmax(factor(p-1)[,1])","))  \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 03 2011
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Mar 20 2001
